query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Luogo è in inferno detto Malebolge, 2 tutto di pietra di color ferrigno, 3 come la cerchia che dintorno il volge.
query.error: **English:** 1 There is a place in Hell called Malebolge, 2 all of stone of a ferrous color, 3 like the circle that surrounds it.
query.result: 1 Is stede on helle ðe is gehaten Malabolge, 2 eal of stane of irenes hiwe, 3 swa ðæs hweowolces ðe hit utan ymbclyppeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Nel dritto mezzo del campo maligno 5 vaneggia un pozzo assai largo e profondo, 6 di cui suo loco dicerò l’ordigno.
query.error: **English:** 4 In the direct middle of the evil field 5 there wanders a well, very wide and deep, 6 of which I will tell you the structure of its place.
query.result: 4 On ðæs feldes midde ðæs mælnes 5 wæs ðær sum putte swipe brad and deop, 6 ðæs ðæs geweorces ic ðe secgan mæg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Quel cinghio che rimane adunque è tondo 8 tra ’l pozzo e ’l piè de l’alta ripa dura, 9 e ha distinto in dieci valli il fondo.
query.error: **English:** 7 That zone which remains is therefore round, 8 between the well and the foot of the hard, high bank, 9 and it has divided the bottom into ten valleys.
query.result: 7 Se ilca wyrm ðe ðær wunað is ymbutan 8 betwux ðam pytte and ðære hean stan hleoðu, 9 and hæfð ða grund toðæled on tyn dalas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Quale, dove per guardia de le mura 11 più e più fossi cingon li castelli, 12 la parte dove son rende figura,
query.error: **English:** 10 Like where for guarding of the walls 11 more and more moats encircle the castles, 12 the part where they are gives back an image,
query.result: 10 Swa hwær swa for wearda ðara wealla 11 ma and ma dicas ymb utan beorgan, 12 ðæt dæl ðær ða sind gelicnesse bringð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 tale imagine quivi facean quelli; 14 e come a tai fortezze da’ lor sogli 15 a la ripa di fuor son ponticelli,
query.error: **English:** 13 such an image those made there; 14 and as to such fortresses from their thresholds 15 to the bank outside there are little bridges,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 così da imo de la roccia scogli 17 movien che ricidien li argini e ’ fossi 18 infino al pozzo che i tronca e raccogli.
query.error: **English:** 16 so from the bottom of the rock cliffs 17 moved that cut off the banks and moats 18 down to the well that cuts them off and collects them.
query.result: 16 swa of ðam grunde ðara stana scofas 17 stigon ðe tosliton ða eargas and ða dicas 18 oð ðone pytt ðe ða tosceade and gegaderode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 In questo luogo, de la schiena scossi 20 di Gerïon, trovammoci; e ’l poeta 21 tenne a sinistra, e io dietro mi mossi.
query.error: **English:** 19 In this place, from the back I slid down 20 of Geryon, we found ourselves; and the poet 21 kept to the left, and I moved behind him.
query.result: 19 On ðissum stede, of ðære hrycge ic sceat 20 Geriones, we ðær fundon us; and se scop 21 heold to ðære wynstran, and ic æfter him teah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 A la man destra vidi nova pieta, 23 novo tormento e novi frustatori, 24 di che la prima bolgia era repleta.
query.error: **English:** 22 On the right hand I saw a new pain, 23 a new torment and new scourgers, 24 with which the first ditch was replete.
query.result: 22 On ðære swiðran handa ic geseah niwe yrmðu, 23 niwe tintreg and niwe tintregendras, 24 ðe ða æreste dic wæs mid afylled.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Nel fondo erano ignudi i peccatori; 26 dal mezzo in qua ci venien verso ’l volto, 27 di là con noi, ma con passi maggiori,
query.error: **English:** 25 At the bottom, the sinners were naked; 26 from the middle on, they came toward us, 27 on the other side with us, but with greater strides,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 come i Roman per l’essercito molto, 29 l’anno del giubileo, su per lo ponte 30 hanno a passar la gente modo colto,
query.error: **English:** 28 like the Romans during the great jubilee, 29 cross the bridge in a well-ordered manner, 30 so that on one side they all have their faces
query.result: 28 swa swa ða Romanisce men ðurh ða miclan fyrde, 29 ðæt ger ðæs geares, ofer ða brycge 30 habbað to faranne ðæt folc gerecenlice,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 che da l’un lato tutti hanno la fronte 32 verso ’l castello e vanno a Santo Pietro, 33 da l’altra sponda vanno verso ’l monte.
query.error: **English:** 31 turned toward the castle and go to Saint Peter's, 32 while on the other side they go toward the mountain.
query.result: 31 ðæt of ðæm anum ende ealle habbað ða neb 32 ongean ðone castel and farað to Sancte Petres, 33 of ðæm oðrum ende farað ongean ðone munt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Di qua, di là, su per lo sasso tetro 35 vidi demon cornuti con gran ferze, 36 che li battien crudelmente di retro.
query.error: **English:** 34 On this side, on that, up on the gloomy rock, 35 I saw horned demons with great scourges, 36 who beat them cruelly from behind.
query.result: 34 Her on ðisse healfe, her on ðære healfe, uppon ðæm hatan stane, 35 ic geseah deofla gehornede mid miclum swipum, 36 ða ða hi ða synfullan beoton beæftan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Ahi come facean lor levar le berze 38 a le prime percosse! già nessuno 39 le seconde aspettava né le terze.
query.error: **English:** 37 Ah, how the cranes made them rise up 38 at the first blows! No one 39 waited for the second or the third.
query.result: 37 Eala, hu ða earnas ðær ða æglæcean 38 æt ðam ærestan plegan! Næs ðær nænig 39 ðe ðæs oðres abid ðonne ðæs ðriddan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Mentr’ io andava, li occhi miei in uno 41 furo scontrati; e io sì tosto dissi: 42 «Già di veder costui non son digiuno».
query.error: **English:** 40 While I was going, my eyes in one 41 were met; and I so quickly said: 42 "I am not yet fasting from seeing this one".
query.result: 40 Þa ic fór, mine eagan on án 41 wurdon fæste; and ic ða sona cwæð: 42 "Nis me ðæs gesyhðes gyt forðýned".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Per ch’ïo a figurarlo i piedi affissi; 44 e ’l dolce duca meco si ristette, 45 e assentio ch’alquanto in dietro gissi.
query.error: **English:** 43 Therefore I set my feet to describe it; 44 and the gentle leader stopped with me, 45 and consented that I should go back a little.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 46 And se geswenctiða wende ðæt he hine bemide 47 ðurh ðæt ðe he ðone neb astrehte; ac him lyt ðuhte, 48 ða ic cwæð: "Ðu ðe ða eagan on eorðan sendest,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 se le fazion che porti non son false, 50 Venedico se’ tu Caccianemico. 51 Ma che ti mena a sì pungenti salse?».
query.error: **English:** 49 if the features that you bear are not false, 50 you are Venedico Caccianemico. 51 But what brings you to such sharp trials?
query.result: 49 gif ða hiw ðe ðu berst ne beoð lease, 50 Venedico ðu eart Caccianimico. 51 Ac hwæt ðe lædde on ðas bitran brimu?».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Ed elli a me: «Mal volontier lo dico; 53 ma sforzami la tua chiara favella, 54 che mi fa sovvenir del mondo antico.
query.error: **English:** 52 And he to me: "I am loath to tell it; 53 but your clear speech compels me, 54 which makes me recall the ancient world.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 I’ fui colui che la Ghisolabella 56 condussi a far la voglia del marchese, 57 come che suoni la sconcia novella.
query.error: **English:** 55 I was the one who led Ghisolabella 56 to do the will of the marquis, 57 however the scandalous story may sound.
query.result: 55 Ic wæs se ðe ða Ghisolabellan 56 lædde ðæt heo ðæs marqueses willan gefremede, 57 þeah ðe ðæt mære mæðelic þince.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 E non pur io qui piango bolognese; 59 anzi n’è questo loco tanto pieno, 60 che tante lingue non son ora apprese
query.error: **English:** 58 And not only do I weep here, a Bolognese; 59 rather, this place is so full of them, 60 that so many tongues are not now learned

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 a dicer ‘sipa’ tra Sàvena e Reno; 62 e se di ciò vuoi fede o testimonio, 63 rècati a mente il nostro avaro seno».
query.error: **English:** 61 to say ‘yes’ between the Savena and the Reno; 62 and if you want proof or testimony of this, 63 call to mind our avaricious nature.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Così parlando il percosse un demonio 65 de la sua scurïada, e disse: «Via, 66 ruffian! qui non son femmine da conio».
query.error: **English:** 64 Thus speaking, a demon struck him 65 with his whip, and said: "Get out of here, 66 pimp! There are no whores here for you."
query.result: 64 Þus sprecende hine sloh a deofol 65 mid his swipan, and cwæð: "Gewit nu, 66 sceocca! Her nis nan feohgestreona."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 I’ mi raggiunsi con la scorta mia; 68 poscia con pochi passi divenimmo 69 là ’v’ uno scoglio de la ripa uscia.
query.error: **English:** 67 I rejoined my guide; 68 then with a few steps we came 69 to where a cliff jutted out from the bank.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Assai leggeramente quel salimmo; 71 e vòlti a destra su per la sua scheggia, 72 da quelle cerchie etterne ci partimmo.
query.error: **English:** 70 We climbed it very easily; 71 and, turning to the right, up along its ridge, 72 we departed from those eternal circles.

query.prompt:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 lo viso in te di quest’ altri mal nati, 77 ai quali ancor non vedesti la faccia 78 però che son con noi insieme andati».
query.error: **English:** 76 your gaze upon these other ill-born ones, 77 whose faces you have not yet seen, 78 because they have walked with us together."
query.result: 76 ðin gesiho on ðisum oðrum yflum acennedum, 77 ðæra ðu ða wlite ne gesawe, 78 forðæm ðe hi mid us samod eodon."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Del vecchio ponte guardavam la traccia 80 che venìa verso noi da l’altra banda, 81 e che la ferza similmente scaccia.
query.error: **English:** 79 From the old bridge we watched the trace 80 that came towards us from the other bank, 81 and which the whip similarly drives away.
query.result: 79 Of ðæm ealdan brycge we gesawon ða læstas 80 ðe comon ongean us of ðære oðre healfe, 81 and ða ða swurda eall swylce adræfde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 E ’l buon maestro, sanza mia dimanda, 83 mi disse: «Guarda quel grande che vene, 84 e per dolor non par lagrime spanda:

query.result: 82 And ða goda lareow, butan minum ascununga, 83 cwæð to me: "Loca ðone miclan ðe ðær cymeð, 84 and for ðære sorge ne ondræt ðæt he tearas ne gewepe:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 quanto aspetto reale ancor ritene! 86 Quelli è Iasón, che per cuore e per senno 87 li Colchi del monton privati féne.
query.error: **English:** 85 how much royal bearing he still retains! 86 That is Jason, who by heart and by wisdom 87 deprived the Colchians of the fleece of the ram.
query.result: 85 hu micelne cynelicne hiw he gyt hæfð! 86 Þæt is Iason, se ðe ðurh heortan and ðurh hyge 87 ða Colcas ðæs fleoses benæmde."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Ello passò per l’isola di Lenno 89 poi che l’ardite femmine spietate 90 tutti li maschi loro a morte dienno.
query.error: **English:** 88 He passed by the island of Lemnos, 89 after the bold and pitiless women 90 had put all their men to death.
query.result: 88 He ofer Lenno ða igland gewand, 89 ðær ða wælhreowan wif wæron, 90 ða hyra agne weras to deade gedydon hæfdon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Ivi con segni e con parole ornate 92 Isifile ingannò, la giovinetta 93 che prima avea tutte l’altre ingannate.
query.error: **English:** 91 There, with signs and ornate words, 92 Isifile deceived her, the young girl 93 who had previously deceived all the others.
query.result: 91 Þær mid tacnum and mid wordum wisum 92 Isifile ða geðeahte, ða geongan mægð, 93 ðe ær æror ða oðre gedwælde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Con lui sen va chi da tal parte inganna; 98 e questo basti de la prima valle 99 sapere e di color che ’n sé assanna».
query.error: **English:** 97 With him goes whoever deceives from that side; 98 and this suffices to know of the first valley 99 and of those who ensnare themselves in it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Già eravam là ’ve lo stretto calle 101 con l’argine secondo s’incrocicchia, 102 e fa di quello ad un altr’ arco spalle.
query.error: **English:** 100 Now we were there where the narrow road 101 intersects with the second embankment, 102 and makes a shoulder of that to another arch.
query.result: 100 Nu wæron we ðær ðær se nearwe stigel 101 mid ðæm oðrum wealle gewrixled wæs, 102 and ðone ðurh ðone oðerne bogan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Quindi sentimmo gente che si nicchia 104 ne l’altra bolgia e che col muso scuffa, 105 e sé medesma con le palme picchia.
query.error: **English:** 103 Then we heard people who were whining 104 in the other ditch and who were striking their snouts, 105 and beating themselves with their palms.
query.result: 103 Þa we gehyrdon folc ðe ðær feohte, 104 on ðære oðre byrig, and ða mid nosum scufon, 105 and hi sylfe mid handum beoton.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Le ripe eran grommate d’una muffa, 107 per l’alito di giù che vi s’appasta, 108 che con li occhi e col naso facea zuffa.
query.error: **English:** 106 The banks were covered with a mold, 107 because of the breath from below that congeals there, 108 which made war with my eyes and nose.
query.result: 106 Þa oferbreddu wæron oferwrogene mid anum mosan, 107 for ðæs niðeweardes blædes ðe ðær on wæs gemenged, 108 ðe mid ðam eagum and ðære næse wæs winnende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Lo fondo è cupo sì, che non ci basta 110 loco a veder sanza montare al dosso 111 de l’arco, ove lo scoglio più sovrasta.
query.error: **English:** 109 The bottom is so deep that it is not enough for us 110 to see it without climbing to the top 111 of the arch, where the rock overhangs the most.
query.result: 109 Se ðæt fæsten is swa deop ðæt us ne mæg 110 stede genihtsumian to ðæs ðæt we hit geseon, 111 buton we ufan stigon ðæs bogan, ðær se brycg ofer ðone stan wyrðeð hehst.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Quivi venimmo; e quindi giù nel fosso 113 vidi gente attuffata in uno sterco 114 che da li uman privadi parea mosso.
query.error: **English:** 112 There we came; and then down in the ditch 113 I saw people plunged in excrement 114 that seemed to have been produced by deprived humans.
query.result: 112 Þær we comon; and ðanon siððan 113 ic geseah ða leode on ðam flode 114 besencte on ðam mixen ðe ða menniscan sceome sculon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 E mentre ch’io là giù con l’occhio cerco, 116 vidi un col capo sì di merda lordo, 117 che non parëa s’era laico o cherco.
query.error: **English:** 115 And while I searched there with my eyes, 116 I saw someone whose head was so covered in excrement, 117 that it was not clear whether he was a layman or a cleric.
query.result: 115 And ða ða ic ðær mid ðam eagum sohte, 116 ða geseah ic ðær sumne ðæs heafod wæs swa mid dritum beloren, 117 ðæt hit næs gesyne hwæðer hit wære læwede oððe clerec.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 già t’ho veduto coi capelli asciutti, 122 e se’ Alessio Interminei da Lucca: 123 però t’adocchio più che li altri tutti».

query.result: 121 ic ðe geseah hwilon mid haren loccum, 122 and ðu eart Alexis Interminei of Luca: 123 forðæm ic ðe behealde swiðor ðonne ða oðre."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Ed elli allor, battendosi la zucca: 125 «Qua giù m’hanno sommerso le lusinghe 126 ond’ io non ebbi mai la lingua stucca».
query.error: **English:** 124 And he then, beating his pate: 125 "Here below the flatteries have drowned me, 126 on which I never had my tongue sated."
query.result: 124 And he ða, beotende his heafod: 125 "Her niðer me awegdon ða flaterungas, 126 ðara ic næfre næfde ðone tungan sacu."

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Appresso ciò lo duca «Fa che pinghe», 128 mi disse, «il viso un poco più avante, 129 sì che la faccia ben con l’occhio attinghe

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 di quella sozza e scapigliata fante 131 che là si graffia con l’unghie merdose, 132 e or s’accoscia e ora è in piedi stante.

130 of that filthy and disheveled maidservant 131 who scratches herself there with her filthy nails, 132 and now crouches down and now stands upright.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Taïde è, la puttana che rispuose 134 al drudo suo quando disse “Ho io grazie 135 grandi apo te?”: “Anzi maravigliose!”.
query.error: **English:** 133 She is Thaïs, the harlot who answered 134 her lover when he said, “Do I have 135 great favors from you?”: “Wondrous ones!”
query.result: 133 Þæt is Thaïs, seo hure ðe andwyrde 134 hyre leofmonne ða he cwæð “Hæbbe ic ænige 135 micle ðancige æt ðe?”: “Wundorlice!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 E quinci sian le nostre viste sazie».
query.error: **English:** 136 And here let our sight be satisfied.
query.result: 136 And her sýn úre gesyhðe genyhtsum.
